Get specified table from OxCOVID19 Database

Source: R/get_table.R
get_table.Rd

Get specified table from OxCOVID19 Database

get_table(con, tbl_name)

Arguments

con

Connection to OxCOVID19 Database. This can be specified using the connect_oxcovid19 function.
tbl_name

Name of table available in OxCOVID19 Database. Should be one of the table names given by a call to list_tables.

Value

An RPostgres_tbl object of the specified OxCOVID19 Database table

Author

Ernest Guevarra

Examples

con <- connect_oxcovid19()
get_table(con = con, tbl_name = "epidemiology")

#> # Source:   table<epidemiology> [?? x 15]
#> # Database: postgres [covid19@covid19db.org:5432/covid19]
#>    source date       country countrycode adm_area_1 adm_area_2 adm_area_3 tested
#>    <chr>  <date>     <chr>   <chr>       <chr>      <chr>      <chr>       <int>
#>  1 WRD_W… 2020-03-29 Equato… GNQ         NA         NA         NA             NA
#>  2 WRD_W… 2020-01-14 Puerto… PRI         NA         NA         NA             NA
#>  3 WRD_W… 2020-01-16 Puerto… PRI         NA         NA         NA             NA
#>  4 BRA_M… 2020-06-02 Brazil  BRA         Rio de Ja… NA         NA             NA
#>  5 BRA_M… 2020-06-02 Brazil  BRA         São Paulo  NA         NA             NA
#>  6 WRD_W… 2020-03-31 Equato… GNQ         NA         NA         NA             NA
#>  7 USA_N… 2020-09-05 United… USA         Illinois   Douglas    NA             NA
#>  8 WRD_W… 2020-07-23 Egypt   EGY         NA         NA         NA             NA
#>  9 USA_N… 2020-04-12 United… USA         Nebraska   Seward     NA             NA
#> 10 BRA_M… 2020-06-02 Brazil  BRA         Acre       NA         NA             NA
#> # … with more rows, and 7 more variables: confirmed <int>, recovered <int>,
#> #   dead <int>, hospitalised <int>, hospitalised_icu <int>, quarantined <int>,
#> #   gid <chr>
